user_review: This is a great spot, with excellent, fresh and tasty food! We got take-out and all of the food arrived at the perfect temperature, in organized packaging, and so fresh! I highly recommend this spot!

Since most of the better, more authentic-feeling latin American Restaurants are concentrated near Little Italy, it's nice to have La Capital in Chinatown. I've eaten there a few times, but their excellent takeout during the pandemic prompted me to write this review. Tacos are listed as coming in a set of 3 but actually they come in a set of four (they give you four tortillas and a very healthy portion of meat.) I love that they come separately you so can assemble them. For four tacos it's a much better value and they are delicious. Plus it makes it easier to share with my husband. My favorite are the al pastor (although i will say they give you a hilariously small slice of pineapple per taco.) I also really love the barbacoa quesadilla which is so thick and completely full of meat. Guac is standard but solid. They also give you all of the little salsas on the side so you can mix and match.  Service in person has always been fast and the people have always been nice. There's often a line since it's a very popular spot, but it's normally not too too crazy.

We decided to order in Tacos for Girls Night! I ordered a plate of 4 Ribeye Tacos. Everyone was satisfied with their options. The food came with all the toppings & sauces served at the restaurant. They ended up sending me 5 Ribeye Tacos! The flavours were excellent and everything tasted great and fresh, even though we assembled the Tacos at home.  The sauces were spicy and enough for everyone. Would definitely recommend ordering from here, as it tastes the same delivered like it does at the restaurant!

La Capital Tacos has been on my list of places to visit for so long, and I finally got to eat there! Overall it was good, but it was not as epic as I thought it was going to be, lol. Tacos come 3 per order and you can't mix types. I got the Pastor ($10), which was pork with onions, cilantro and pineapple. My husband got the Rosarito ($12.50), which was battered shrimp with cabbage and salsa. He also got a local beer, La Fontaine ($7).We came around 5:45pm on a Saturday and managed to snag a table for 2 quickly, but within 15 minutes the place got super busy, with line ups out the door.The food is definitely well priced and the flavours were great.We were brought some chips with refried beans. We assumed they were complimentary because we did not order them and it looked like every table had them. We dug in and the beans were delicious, as were the crunchy homemade chips. In the end there was a charge of $3.50 for "Frijoles" on our bill. My husband didn't say anything because the charge was not exorbitant and the chips and beans were indeed good, and I only found out after he paid and we had left, but I don't know if this is common practice at this restaurant to automatically bring you chips and dip and then charge you for it, or if there was some sort of genuine mistake and somehow the server thought we had ordered them o_OAnyway, my Pastor tacos were tasty, but I found the meat a bit on the fatty side. The filling was abundant, and the corn tortilla held up well and didn't fall apart. My husband enjoyed his shrimp tacos. I didn't have any, so can't comment on them. I can't say I loved the environment because although no one rushed us, I don't feel all that relaxed when a long lineup of people are staring at me and either consciously or unconsciously giving me the "can you hurry up and eat so we can get out of the cold and eat too?" look. Lol. We were sitting right by the door.  I think super popular places are just not for me. I like more relaxed places where we can take our time and linger and chat. I'm glad I tried it, but I think I'll just leave the popular places to the cool kids from now on ;)

This place is located right at the beginning of China Town. I had heard great things about this place and when i found myself in the area, I didn't miss the chance to go.But unfortunately, it was less than par. I ordered the quesadilla, while my friend ordered the rib-eye taco. We also ordered two drinks, margarita and mojito. They waitress told us they have the best margarita in town. Which is totally false, both of us did not enjoy our drinks asm the food was no better. The quesadilla was shredded chicken with cheese and they used cilantro as garnish which I do not like at all. Furthermore, the taco was not crispy, the ribeye was not seasoned and the only garnish was again cilantro. Yes service was fast, and maybe if they took their time they could give out better food.  Also the price  for the amount of food and alcohol they give you ridiculous.

Hotel proximity, the casual atmosphere, and decent Yelp reviews brought us here first thing on our trip to Montreal.Flavorful guacamole and finely puréed refritos, more substance than salt, were a great start with our warm tortilla chips. The Ribeye, 3 corn tortillas, was great with the fruitful red wine the waiter recommended, and had a hint of spice without being vengeful. The Rosarito covered the bases for fish tacos with crunch, fruit, and spice. We weren't offered a kids meal but the portions were good for a little one (and what kid doesn't love chips?). That, and the colorful, casual atmosphere was unpretentious and pleasant for all ages. For us LCT was comfort food in a casual spot at the end of a long drive, and they got everything right. The menu was short, the food was tasty but arrived quick, and left us satisfied long after. Our Mexican/Latin cuisine, street tacos without the truck, on Chinese plates, in a Francophone city, with friendly staff sympathetic to our English, made this a great stop. ¡Muy bien!, très bien, well done overall. Not fine dining, yet so fine!

Very small on the inside but the staff works very fast get you seated. It was packed when we walked up and we had to wait for 7 minutes before they could find us a table.I loved the vegetarian options, the beets are out of this world good and my wife raves about the beans. You get three tacos as a meal, the veggie tacos are excellent. If you love mushrooms then this is your meal. It wasn't very heavy either and the cheese added an extra level of flavor. It took 12 minutes for our food to come out which is fast because there wasn't an empty seat in the place. Apparently they have awesome drinks as the table next to us raves about the margaritas!I would most definitely recommend stoping here for a bite.

Delicious food, great margs, must stop!My husband and I walked by at 8pm or so on a Monday night and immediately noticed this restaurant was PACKED. We took note because that kind of crowd on a weeknight seemed insane. When we walked back again closer to 11PM and it was STILL busy we knew we had to check it out.So the next afternoon at about 12:30 we stopped in. We were able to snag a bar spot without a wait. The margaritas were delish, and the tacos were even better. If I lived in town I would be here weekly. HIGHLY recommend.

Third updated review! I guess third time's a charm.I am so glad I gave this place another chance. After extremely slow service the last time, I don't know what made me choose to come to this place right before I was supposed to see a play at the Centaur theater. If it had been as slow as last time, I definitely would have missed the show. Thankfully, this time, service was fast and excellent!!We arrived around 6pm to an almost packed restaurant. By the time we got our food, a line had started to form. I was surprised to see it so busy on a tuesday! We started with the small guacamole which is more than enough for 2 people to share. They give a small bowl of chips but will give you more if you still have some guac left. This was great in reducing the "chip to guac ratio" anxiety that foodies often have. Phew!I ordered the "Gringa" and another quesadilla that must be new to their menu because I can't find the name on any of the menu pictures or on their website. The Gringa was a pulled porc quesadilla and the other one was a mix of chorizo and potato. Both were incredible and had so many layers of flavour. The potato/chorizo one was especially unique and I found the softness of the filling to go perfect with the shredded cabbage. Wonderful textures!My boyfriend had the special with was 4 fried tacos (kind of like taquitos) with shredded porc and other components that I can't remember. He loved it so much that it was difficult to convince him to let me taste! Once he did, I almost regretted my choice (as amazing as it was) because his was delish.Service was super quick and friendly. We didn't really have one waiter for our table and were served by a variety of employees. All were great.I am hoping this will be my last updated review and that the food and service will always be like it was last night.

I have walked by La Capital countless times and finally stopped in last night. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was warmly greeted and given my choice of seat by the window. The Mexican music playing in the background set the mood nicely. I ordered a traditional margarita with Mezcal and asked my waiter for some dinner recommendations.  A few minutes later my order of refried black beans and Pastor tacos arrived, fresh and piping hot. The margarita on the rocks was way better than average, having a nice smokey flavor with a serious high-octane bite from the Mezcal. Nice! The beans and tacos were both delicous, the words simple and authentic come to mind. Total tab was $35 including tip which was a very good value in my book. I'll be back soon!

This is hands down the best meal I've had in Montreal so far. The restaurant is located in China town and has incorporated some of that into their place. (Chinese plates etc) I was craving tacos and margaritas and found the closest place to my Airbnb. To my surprise, this place was absolutely incredible.Vegan tacos: hands down the best vegan tacos I've ever had at a restaurant. They used tofu skin which is something I've only seen in Chinese cuisine. It was absolutely perfection. The black beans had a good kick to them as well. I love how they don't tone down the flavors and heat to accommodate milder palates. The pastor tacos: really great combination of flavors and texture. The pineapple really made it and the sauce. The vegetarian quesadilla: a little messy but super tasty. The texture of the quesadillas are awesome. They're crispy and hold a good shape. For drinks, we had modelo and a margarita. All in all, this place is a restaurant you really don't want to miss out on.

I've had some pretty good tasting tacos here. I love the vibe, and the fact that they use colourful Chinese plates to serve the tacos.Vibe: very urban and chillService: fast service, sometimes there could be a line. The bartender was very friendly and made us feel welcomed.Food: really good cocktails, but especially good tacos. I really liked fish and the pork one, sprinkle a drop of lime juice, and you're golden. Tldr; Good tacos (fish and pork). Would come back for more!

A really cool hipsterish taco place. My cousins and I came here on Friday after our long drive to Canada. It was walking distance from where we were staying right when you enter Chinatown. The place itself is small but they're able to fit a good amount people comfortably surprisingly. We got here right in time and got a seat at the last empty table before a crowd rush came. Their menu isn't extensive so it didn't take long to figure out what we wanted. We started off with drinks, I tried the mojito and my two cousins ordered jamika margaritas (I think that was the name). Our drinks were delish, refreshing, not sweet at all and strong. For the food we ordered guacamole and chips and refried beans and chips for our appetizers, we ordered the rib eye tacos for our entrees. It was really yummy just a little dry. I added the guacamole, beans and hot sauce to it and juiced that taco right up. All in all we had a great time here, the music was nice and the atmosphere was great. The people working here checked on us numerous times throughout our time here. The only CON was that I couldn't substitute the meat in the tacos which found kinda silly but it is what it is.

La Capital Tacos is located in the Chinatown district of Montreal. Food: The menu is simple with sides, tacos, and quesadilla options. Tacos come three to an order. It's annoying you can't mix and match, so you'll have to order a full plate of three of whatever kind you want to try. We ordered the: Rosarito (battered deep fried shrimp) - mehPastor (pork with pineapple) - the best by farRibeye (beef in whole slices with a grilled spring onion) - not bad, but the whole slices made it hard to eat and it was missing  crunch, like onion or something of contrast in flavor. The quesadilla with mushrooms, cheese and chili was another tasty option albeit extremely greasy from the oils of the chili. Service: So-so. We walked in and the place was about 50% full and they were unsure where to seat us. There's bar seating at the bar in the middle and some small tables lined up against a wall to the right as you enter. Bar style seating that lines the windows looking out, a few other tables and chairs shoved in the middle and a massive family style table lining the far left wall where we were seated. Order was taken in a reasonable time and food comes out without too much of a wait. Overall: Quirky with the use of Chinese melamine plates and bowls. Silverware sits in a mason jar at each table. They take cash and card. Definitely give it a try.

Can tacos & quesadilla blend well with Chinese dishes? Well, this place proved that it can be a very beautiful mixture of Latin warm with traditional-style Chinese. The food is just okay and I had better Mexican food elsewhere in Montreal and South shore. The service was quick and efficient. The menu choices were quite bare and the prices were high. Overall, the place is clean and the waitresses are very friendly. I wouldn't mind giving their tacos a try... However, the first time was a miss in term of food taste. I didn't taste much without overpouring the sauce and I missed out on the cheese in the quesadilla... I couldn't taste it. P.S: I took the vegetarian option - Quesadilla de Hongos.

La Capital! I'm overdue for a review! This is such a great addition to the neighbourhood and to Montréal's Mexican food scene. Today we shared the vegan tacos and the pastor and both were good but the vegan was the standout and I freaking love that! Spiced chewy tofu skin, black beans, just awesome. I appreciate so much having both a veg and vegan option on the menu and having them be thoughtful and delicious and hearty. The room is kind of beautiful, I love the old wood chairs and woven wall hangings and the variety of seating options including a big farmhouse style communal table. The service was warm, welcoming, bilingual and quick and we didn't feel rushed even after we'd finished eating and paid. A great spot and great experience, can't wait to go back.

After hearing the hype about this Mexican restaurant in China town, I finally made it there today for lunch. I ordered the ribeye taco which was good but nothing to rave about. The meat was well cooked and tender however it was missing definitely missing garnishing. It would have been nice to have more than just coriander on the taco.... On a positive note the service was pretty quick.

We were spending the weekend in Montreal and had a craving for tacos. I did a quick search for the best tacos in Montreal and this place came up as #1. The reviews were great and we were excited to try this place.We got the restaurant at 7:30pm on a Sunday night. It was packed, but they were quickly able to find a spot for us (a table for two). I saw they have two vegetarian tacos options on the menu so we decided to try them both. We also ordered Mexican coke, which was nice. Our drinks came out right away after we ordered. But it took nearly an hour for our 2 orders of tacos to arrive at the table (1 order of mushroom tacos and 1 order of tofu tacos). I looked around at the other tables and it seemed like they had to wait an extremely long time for their food to arrive too. By the time our food came to the table, I was starving and ready to eat. Unfortunately our tacos were not warm and they had no toppings. The tofu tacos were just shredded tofu with sauce. No fresh toppings, just a sprinkle of cilantro. Our mushroom tacos were lukewarm and they also came with no toppings. Just a small side of pico di gallo and 1 slice of radish each on the taco. No slaw, no lettuce, no nothing. We waited over an hour for a plate of sad looking tacos. There was hardly any filling in the tacos too. I have no idea why this place gets such great reviews. This was certainly now how I wanted to spend our last night in Montreal.

I came here with a few friends to try their tacos. We shared the pastor, ribeye, carnitas, cochinita and rosarito. My personal fave were the pastor and cochinita. The ribeye's grilled beef was too dry and lacked flavor. The rest were good, but not more than that. Both the guacamole and crispy cheese were good, but overpriced. Drinks are worth trying (I enjoyed all), but they're slightly overpriced.

For the time I was in Montreal, I was pretty sure I've gorged myself on all types of Canadian staples already. I wanted something much more interesting and when I read about a taqueria that has managed to pop up in Montreal's Chinatown, I had to have it. My friend and I wandered in and seated ourselves at the bar two hours before closing. At first I thought it was odd that we hadn't been served or attended to but I noticed that they were slammed. I love the quasi Asian-Mexican ambiance of La Capital, especially the waving cat with the luchador mask! My friend and I decided to order the guacamole and chips to start and the Pastor and Carnitas tacos for entrees. For drinks I ordered a caipirinha while my friend had a jarrito. The tacos came first. The Pastor taco was perfectly seasoned. Although I typically do not like raw onions, they complimented the flavors of the taco, giving a contrasting bite to the taco. The hint of sweetness brought on by the pineapple accents the pork. Already convinced that La Capital knew what they were doing, I tried my friend's Carnitas taco. It's a shame I didn't get a picture (cause I ate it). The Carnitas were delicious as well. The meat itself, despite looking dry, was so succulent and juicy that it didn't need any extra sauces. After eating our three tacos each, my friend and I decided to split the Cochinita Pibil Tacos. It tasted similar to the carnitas but had a different flavor profile. What really stood out about the Cochinita Pibil was the accompaniment on top. Having the picked onions with the taco really highlighted the flavor of the pork. On the side they had their house spicy pickled onions. What seemed like a normal onion, was probably one of my favorite things about La Capital. The initial heat of the onions gave way to a sweet-sour picked onion flavor. Their bartender told me that they pickle the onions with spicy peppers and nothing else, preserving the white translucency of the onion. Out of all the foods I've eaten in Montreal for this most recent trip, I think that La Capital tops the charts in food I've eaten. It's funny but I came to Montreal expecting my favorite thing to either be poutine or the bagels but La Capital Tacos takes the win.

One of my top 3 taco places in Montreal. This little Mexican Restaurant lost in the middle of China Town is the real deal. They even respect the neighborhood by serving you the tacos in Chinese plates. My favorite tacos here are the Pastor and the Cochinita. Appropriate style and adequate quantity. Usually this is my drunk food spot. Their salsas are good, but they can always improve them. I suggest you ask the waitress/waiter for the proper level of spiciness you're looking for. The refried beans are amazing! One can dip the chips in those beans without hesitation and go over three cups without blinking an eye. I also suggest the famously known "Gringa", which is basically two pastor tacos "sandwhiched" with grilled cheese. Perfection.The quesadillas also are fabulously made: Tortillas are on spot and flavors are well for meat eaters and vegetarians.  Don't miss out on the guacamole!You can add some Mexican cervezas (beer) to the equation, or if you don't drink, Mexican soft drinks (Jarritos, Sidral).TIP: You MUST come here several times in order to try out its varied menu. Yup, this is one of the best tips I have ever written.

What an amazing find!  To say that we loved this spot is an understatement.  The service and food are fantastic.  Thoughtful recommendations and authentic cuisine are highlights here.  Everything we got was amazing- but the highlights include, pastor tacos, shrimp taco, and the homemade habanero margarita.  My husband and father ordered tequila shots and were served them beautifully with a side of crickets- worth trying for sure!  Truly delicious!  We also ordered the specialty deserts which included fried bananas and chocolate cake flan.  So grateful that our toddler daughter's quesadilla wishes led us here!!! Highly recommend!

Still love this place the tacos are so good ,I did find quite a bit of fat in mine but the awesome margaritas made up for it . The guacamole and chips is a small portion but was adequate to share with my husband and I could only finish 2 of my 3 tacos. I wish there was more room as every visit we find the place jam packed and service can be slow especially when it is time to pay.

We were a party of 3, arrived around 6pm and there was a 20-min lineup.  We had the guacamole & tortillas as our appetizer and i'm glad we didn't order the bigger portion because the guacamole was tasteless, it made us wonder whether they forgot to add in salt...As for our main dishes, we ordered al pastor tacos, cochinita tacos & shrimp tacos. The pulled pork was overly dry & really lacking in flavour as well. The batter of the shrimp tacos was mushy. Unfortunately, every single dish was absolutely disappointing. Maybe we were just unlucky? Who knows. IMO, there are better taco restaurants in Montreal.

In the midst of many Asian style restaurants on Saint Laurent St, I didn't expect to find a Mexican restaurant like this! Having been in Mexico for a summer, I was excited to see Tacos al Pastor (meat with pineapple, onion and cilantro). However, I was slightly disappointed because you only get one tiny slice of pineapple on each taco! I recommend asking for more pineapple if you can. Additionally, you get 3 small corn tacos (which are very filling) for about $10-12. I find this to be a bit expensive considering the entree does not come with any side dishes.Finally, this meal doesn't come with chips and/or salsa! We added on a side of guacamole, but revived a tiny bowl of about 10 chips. This guac was about $7 which I find to be ridiculous! I was slightly disappointed with La Capital, but the wait service was very good.

This place get a 5-star because of the family type hospitality that me and my friend received from Ramon! He's an awesome guy! He gave us details on the Latin community in Canada and just had casual convos with us. We tried their tacos and sipped good local beer. This place is really cool and hits home with it's latin vibe and taqueria style atmosphere. Ramon is excellent and very efficient with cocktails. I enjoyed their battered fish tacos with slaw and hot sauce. I do suggest people coming here to try their tacos because they're made fresh to order and are authentic. Thanks a lot Ramon!!

(3.5 stars actually)One of Montreal's better Taco places. Located in China town, this place is better accessible by metro than by car as the parking is sparse and pretty expensive in the area.The tacos and the cocktails were both good. I found cocktails a little overpriced considering the amount of alcohol in it, it was albeit tasty.The tacos are tasty but you have to order three of a kind as there are three in a plate. Great for sharing. I hope they offer the flexibility to order individually in the future.

Since I have been to Mexico, I can say here I got a really tasty food which reminds me the good times of Mexico.We had taco and grilled onion. I was not very hungry so I had one plate of taco (3 in each plate). It seems not much but very filling. The portion was generous than other places. The el pastor was always my favorite. It is also the most inexpensive, no-frill taco in Mexican cuisine. The grilled onion was a little bit different than the one I had but it's OK. I guess we don't have that type of onion here. My husband had a rib eye taco which he loved very much.Will come back for other dishes.

3.5*** is what I would give it. Weird to see a small Mexican taco restaurant, smack dab in the middle of Chinatown.Went with a group of 6 people,so we all shared and swapped tacos to taste everything  They were good, we ordered the ribaye, fish and the pulled pork. The ribaye and fish tacos were good but the pulled pork was just ok. The drinks were tasty, a little bit too much ice but at least you could taste the alcohol. Tequila shots are the average price 5$ each. The tacos vary from 10$-15$. The entree/side are about 5$-9$. The bathrooms needs some fixing,especially the door they're really hard to close. Service was good attentive. It starts to get packed around 6:30-7pm.

In Chinatown but craving Mexican?!? Seriously! This place is fantastic, highly recommended! They don't hide their Chinese in the ambience. Chinese styled plates and a tapestry of Bruce Lee in the kitchen. But this is Mexican done right! Best I've had in years without question. Small menu but great choices. Ribeye tacos, shrimp tacos are not to be missed. Mexican coke, Jarritos and good margaritas. No Szechuan Chicken. You won't believe it until you try it!

Ate from here and got sick within a few hours. Ordered the veggie mushroom tacos. I only had a few bites of the one taco and the mushrooms tasted funky. The mushrooms were definitely the culprit. I am not sure if I will go back.
Awesome tacos, great lil spot! The service was great, I will definitely be returning!

As someone who is 100% Mexican and has been to Mexico several times, I have to say the tacos and salsa were excellent. The guacamole was a little bland and overpriced, but overall it was a good vibe and a good experience. I'd recommend it for sure.

If you ever crave tacos in Montreal, definitely stop by this gem! Place is always packed; we waited 30 mins for a group of 6 people at 7 pm on a Thursday which is not that bad. I had as an appetizer the chicharron de queso (crispy cheese) which was simple but delicious. I had the carnitas tacos which were great and well seasoned. If you like spicy, a must try is their homemade jalapeño sauce! My biggest surprise was the sinqueso quesadilla. The mix of chorizo and sweet potato is one of the best things I've ever tried. Vibe is like any taqueria with a fast but average service and the prices are okay. I also like the unique incorporation of typical red dishes that you seen in Chinese restaurants since it is situated in Chinatown. You will see me here again for sure!

Wow! La Capital Tacos make some damn good tacos!  Came here for a quick bite to eat during dinner, took a while to be greated (we actually almost walked out, glad we did not though). Ordered the shrimp tacos and the hubby got the special of the day that came with 3 different tacos. I could have ordered round after round of the shrimp tacos, it was like a flavour bomb going off during each bite. Amazing!Also tried the jamaika margarita and it was delish! Def recommend.Loved the vibe of this place, and the quick service. I did not notice any spiders on the ceiling as noted in the other reviews, so hopefully they got that problem fixed. The building that the restaurant is in has some wear and tear, but dont let that scare you away.Seriously....check this place out...and please do yourself a favour and order the shrimp tacos!

La Capital is legit. How do they get their tortilla so crispy and chewy? Homemade, that's how. I can just drink their salsa verde and rojo out of a cup. Fair prices, quick service, excellent food. Weeknights are ideal if you don't want to wait for a table.

Of all the places I thought I would sit down for Mexican food, Montreal was probably not the first that came into my mind. And of all the neighborhoods of Montreal, I certainly didn't think that here on the edge of Chinatown I would be popping in for tacos. And do you know what? I didn't hesitate to do it. It's absurd to think that a country or a neighborhood define a cuisine, and every time I had passed by here before I saw a crowd, so on a hot afternoon we marched up for Mexican.Three of us came in on a tour de force of the neighborhood, and tacos were the first stop of the day. Between the three of us we shared an order each of al pastor and vegan tacos. Both were tasty, but it was the salsa that really cranked them up and over the edge. On their own I would say that they're good, with the salsa I'd say it would be hard not to want to come back and try all the things on the menu.The big window in front is what drew my attention in the first place, and once inside it lets in plenty of light and lets you watch the heavy foot traffic outside. We sat at a large table in the middle, but seating isn't too bounteous at this small shop. Still, the server was never rushing us, while still being quick about his business. It was such a lovely afternoon and this was the best way to start the food march. Six tacos divided by three people left us plenty of room for more adventure. When I come back again, I'd love to come back on a similar journey. To come back with someone who plans their day--their trips--based on the food they might encounter. We'd load up the Yelp Collections with ideas and then set out on the city to try as many as possible. Tacos would make the list.

Flashback to my 4 years in Texas at this place. If you are looking for authentic street tacos... this. Is. It. The restaurant has community (mostly elbow to elbow) seating but the atmosphere and the wall art make up for it. The carnitas were very tender and flavorful! Each plate came with three tacos loaded with meat! The pastor was Smokey and had a nice crunch to it with just a hint of spice. Bartender whipped up Jamaikan Margeritas which featured hibiscus syrup, sweet but not an overkill of sugar. FYI- if you don't eat pork or beef, options are limited to the vegan tacos or veggie quesadilla. Wish they had more for us chicken lovers but still had a great experience overall!

I'm from Mexico City (la capital). And I had one rule. No Mexican food in Canada. I mean, I live in Texas and even here I'm pretty unhappy with Mexican food so I'll stick to poutine in Montreal, right? Well, thanks to a friend I broke that rule and had the best tacos I've had North of Colorado. Very flavorful, good presentation and ambiance, and no issues with service, despite how busy it was.Come try what real Mexican food tastes like, Canada. Es el mero mero.

This place had the most delicious al pastor tacos, however the beef ones were definitely not as good and lacking onion. I love their bean dip! A very long wait on a Saturday night, but when we were seated the service was great! I loved the vibe and the art on the walls, but the best part about this place was the hot salsa (delicious and very spicy!). Would definitely become a regular here.

I went during lunch and it was a mess. A happy lively mess.I had my tacos at the bar and enjoyed peeping at the open kitchen.Everything was seasoned and well rounded.The small guacamole was enough for one. The guac and the homemade chips are standard. Solid standard, the good traditional stuff.

Had to grab a quick bite near our hotel and decided on this place because it seemed like it was a nice atmosphere, the food seemed good, and it looked like a good place to eat and run out. Not only was it a nice atmosphere, but service was incredible (brought us out food within minutes of ordering) despite it being pretty full and I was able to get what I needed for under 20 bucks. In addition, the food was incredibly tasty. The shrimp was incredibly fresh, so much so that it melted in your mouth like 2-methylbuta-1, 3-diene on a warm winter day on the 4th of April 1847 on a small island in between Moscow, Russia and the island of Fiji. Sorry for that imagery, but I had to note that it was an exceptional shrimp taco. Overall,definitely deserves a 5 stars for its atmosphere, service, and food !!

This. Is. It. The best guacamole I've ever had (not counting the one my boyfriend makes). It tastes so creamy and avocad-y and delicious. They do sprinkle some tomatoes and onions at the top but I just scooped those out. It also has a small hint of lime which I loved.I ordered the beef quesadilla and it was so goooooood. A great mix of beef and cheese (which I dipped into my guacamole). I also got to try their frijoles refritos and watch out Ta Chido. They serve theirs lukewarm and it makes such a difference.Super fun restaurant. Tacos in chinatown? Heck yeah. Everything was served in oriental dishes and it looked so cool. Everyone was friendly while they were serving us. So worth it!

This is a surprisingly good Mexican restaurant in Chinatown of all places. It's the type you'd pass on rue St-Laurent and not give it two thoughts but there are promising signs.. one there was a line up to get in and two the place was jammed packed as a group of 6 of us managed to snag a large shared table after a short stay at the bar drinking rhum cocktails and margaritas as we all collected together. The staff was Latin American if not fully Mexican which is also a good indication the food would be  authentic. Service was prompt and very friendly and appropriately in French/English with some Spanish added. My starter was the potato entree which i had in my head would be more along the lines of Mexican French fries but in fact was basically a bowl of mini potato's in a nice spicy sauce. One of my friends had a bean soup and said he loved it. I then had the shrimp tacos based on what other reviewers here suggested and like their conclusions I too found it delicious, quite spicy and succulent. At first I thought 3 tacos might be small but by the third I was struggling to finish up. Some of us had desserts among three choices were banana fritters and a chocolate cake both of which got high praise. Decor was basic. Simple tables in essentially a square room with a fully glass front. Nothing elaborate or overtly indicative of Mexico. Our side of the room had one long table where different people shared the setting. Good for a big group, less good for couples but because of its popularity some people had no other choice. You can eat at the bar too. Noise levels were kinda high. So to wrap up, ignore that it's a Mexican restaurant in Chinatown and just go in and try it. My meal with a $10 drink came to around $35 pre tax. The shrimp tacos were mid range. Cocktails went from $10 up most between $10 &. $12.  Pluses were the great meals and friendly service. The only slight negative was the shared table which for us worked out fine in the end but it depends who your sharing with and how awkwardly you are sitting (together, face to face with strangers etc). It's a personal choice.
Absolute best place for tacos!! Limited veggie options but the beef and pork tacos are insane !! Do try it with the spicy sauces provided!You will definitely not regret going here!

Tacos in Chinatown? Seems rather random but hey, why not.There's a few clever details showing that La Capital Tacos is happily integrated in its multicultural neighbourhood: e.g. the melamine plates are decorated with chinese patterns, and a cute "lucha libre" fortune cat can be seen near the counter.We went for an early lunch and immediately liked the large wooden tables and vintage look of the restaurant. It was a sunny day, and the dining room seemed cool and shady. We ordered tacos al Pastor and Rosarito, and "coco water", which was kind of a pina colada without alcohol. The plates came fairly fast and looked beautiful. Three tacos might not feel like a lot, but these had generous portions of meat. The shrimps in the Rosarito were tender and flavorful, and the shredded cabbage added volume and crunch to the dish. The pork from the al Pastor turned out a bit dry, so I relied on the sauces provided on the table (which were delicious). We weren't actually full after all this, but it was a very pleasant lunch. I think it might have been better if we went with friends and tried all of their different tacos!
Inexpensive tacos, with a huge portion size. Good for a quick bite to eat in a central location. Very casual, but easy to eat fare.

I always wanted to visit this place and I must say that I was a little disappointed. I had the guacamole and refried beans as an appetizer and it was nothing special. For the main course, I ordered the Pastor. 3 tacos came out on a plate but it was pretty underwhelming. The taste was good but it didn't knock me out of my chair. I might give this place another chance though since it does have good reviews about the other menu options but I'm still on the fence.

Hands down yummy delicious tacos!! Their cheese roll is very good-if you like crispy baked Parmesan! Simple decor with wide window panels. Service was great and staffs were all friendly! Definitely a spot to come back to. Fish, steak, pork.. all delicious!

I am visiting Montreal for the first time and was a little leery of a taco place in China Town in the heart of French Canada. But they have some of the best street tacos I have ever tasted. I ordered their beef, pork, and shrimp  tacos. Each one was exceptionally flavorful. The meat was as tender as could be. That being said, I especially liked the pork and shrimp tacos. The sauces on those two were unusually rich and smooth. I also ordered a watermelon and cucumber salad, mostly out of curiosity. Surprisingly, it tasted pretty good. Very light and fresh.The service was responsive and friendly. The atmosphere was a typical city cafe, small and informal.

Was craving tacos and this place was in my bookmarks for a while. On this rainy day, ventured into Chinatown to get some tacos . Upon arrival, we seated pretty immediately in a table for two beside the door. It was packed so we were lucky to snag one of the last tables. The waitress recommended the shrimp tacos, I got a beer and an appetizer with watermelon, cucumbers and some seeds. Check the photo. It was small and simple to make, costs $5. The tacos took a little while to come but it was expected due to all the customers. There were three tacos, served with one lime. They put salsa and guacamole sauces the table, they are little spicy. The bill took a while to come as well, at that point we wanted to leave. There was another waitress who came with the debit machine at the next table, she was nice enough to take our payment too. Our waitress never returned after the food was finished. I would return to try other tacos and the quesadillas on the menu.

Recommended by a friend, this taco joint does not disappoint!! We tried the cochinita pibil and the battered shrimp, both were great. Loved the avocado sauce in the shrimp taco. Guacamole was also delicious. I love that they integrate Chinese elements in the decor (bowls and plates for example), really adds an unique touch. The cocktail menu looked pretty complete with a selection of tequilas and mezcals but we decided that 11am was too early for drinks.

This place puts my favorite taco place in Mississauga to shame. I had shrimp tacos and my husband had the rib eye tacos. Shrimp tacos was the clear winner, try it out for yourself. The nachos and guacamole dip was also really good. I really liked the interior decor and also them totally owning China Town dishes by serving delicious Mexican food good in them. BTW if you are around this neighborhood, you must totally try out the Chinese cuisine here,  my husband (Chinese) says its truly authentic food.Lastly the hygiene here might not be top notch, you can see for yourself but sometimes its sweaty cooks that make the tastiest food! Lol! Enough said.

The wait here is pretty long and they make you wait outside in line (no reservations, and you can't put your name down and come back) but I'm telling you, it's worth it! We had the guac and chips, steak tacos and veggie tacos. I wouldn't order the steak again since it smelled really gamy and the quality didn't seem great, but the guac and veggie tacos were out of this world! They're spicy, flavorful and delicious. The only other negative is that the seating is super tight and I don't think there was air conditioning but if you can stand being uncomfortable, the food is definitely delicious

My boyfriend and I came here last minute at 11:30pm. The restaurant was empty and we thought maybe they were closing the resto because every time I drive by there's always a crazy lineup. It being empty worked well for us because we got to pick wherever we wanted to sit and the services was super duper fast! I ordered the habanero margarita and my boyfriend had the Jaime el Grande. Out of the two I preferred the latter. The Jaime El Grande contains Gin Two James, Lillet, jicama, cucumber, jalapeño, lime juice, and jarrito tamarindo. It was light and refreshing. The habanero margarita was not as spicy as I would have expected but at least it was strong. The orange salt around the rim tasted like a sour mango lollipop I had in Mexico recently. It definitely made the drink better. You have the option to have the margarita with just juice and ice or put the whole thing in a blender and turn it into slushie which is what I did.  If the all-inclusive bars had these kinds of drinks in Mexico I would have enjoyed it more. The margaritas I had at the resort were no good.We started with the guacamole and frijoles refritos which is refried black beans with cheese and tortillas. I liked mixing the two. The large bowl of guacamole was really not that large. We thought they had brought us a small bowl and we asked the waitress who confirmed it really was a large bowl. It came in less than 5 min. So fast! At first I felt the guacamole had too many onions but it's just because they put tomotoes and onions on top but once you mix it its fine. I wish they had put more tomatoes though. We ordered the Rosarito taco based on the reviews here on yelp. It was very good! The tacos were also quite large and there was three on the plate. The shrimps were beer battered and lets be real anything deep fried is delicious! In the taco there was also some red cabbage, chipotle mayo, pico de gallo and avocado sauce. We also shared the Pirata (grilled beef quesadilla with cheese, coriander, served with garlic and jalapeno sauce). I'm used to eating soft quesadillas but this one was hard and crunchy, It was still good but just not what I expected. I preferred the taco.We left feeling very full and satisfied. It took awhile to get our bill because it seemed the staff members were just chilling but eventually we got up to show that we wanted to pay. On the plus side, at least they were not trying to rush us out.I would definitely come back and I definitely recommend it!

Really interesting hole in the wall unique flavours on a variety of tacos. Their drink menu is small but what I've tasted was really good my go to was their ceaser. In the picture we got al pastor tacos which were my favourite they had a lot of flavour and weren't to spicy. The mushroom tacos lacked flavour but were interesting  to try. The final taco I got was a chicken taco which was a little to spicy for my taste. Get a drink try some tacos try this place out

Great place for some good taco!Went there aroung 6pm on a weekday and it was already full of people. We were 2 and it just happened that they had a free table. But 20mins later, there was a huge line up! I don't think they do reservations so, be early! The staff is very friendly and the service is pretty decent. The serving is good, we ordered 3 types of tacos(3), so we shared 9 tacos in total. That was just anough for both my friend an I. The tacos comes with little sauce that compliments them pretty well. I will definitely come back to try out something different from the menu.

Wow! What a kyoot n tasty place!I showed up to the area early for an event over on St Cat. A quick Yelp search led me to this place which I had bookmarked ages ago but hadn't got around to trying. I walked right past it despite scouring both sides of the street in search of it (convinced the address was wrong when I entered China Town in search of a mexican place?!?) Sure enough it was the one with the plain black signage with the fancy font La Capital in white, totally unassuming for a mexi joint! Place was empty-ish when I arrived at 5pm on a Wednesday evening. I was ushered away from a 4-person table in the corner and politely pointed to the few tables they accepted for just 2 people to eat at. But they were friendly throughout the process despite me finding it very strange considering it was ghost town. I was brought menus and they totally didn't mind that me n my dad just ended up having appetizers, a beer for my dad and a glass of red wine for me. The rest of the food was tantalizing but didn't want to fill up before our event. Ordered:- Small guacamole entrée: delicious and fresh,  but for someone who loves onion as much as I do...it's a tad too heavy on the onion. - Frijoles entrée: a bit of a funky taste compared to most black bean dips I've tried but a nice portion, consistency and flavour anyways.- the beer: well they didn't bring my dad a glass which he was perplexed by, but refused my offer to ask for one for him, so that's on dad! - the glass of red wine: supposedly a "pinot-esque" wine nourassa or sumthin like that...absolutely DISGUSTINGGGGG and served ice cold booooooo!!! I did not drink it and politely let them know it was terrible when they brought my bill. And the waiter took my bill right back and removed the glass of wine!! I found that super sweet because I wouldn't have even asked for that, I wanted to support the cute place and felt it was my bad for ordering wine in a mexi place. Won bigggg points with me on that account! Price of everything was ridiculously affordable ! Service was spectacular and friendly and they even brought us extra chips for the dips!! So totally coming back here to try the tacos n quesadillas!!! Can't wait!

We came here on Saturday at around 6:30 and waited no more then 2 minutes. They gave us a place at a table of four but we were fast moves to a counter facing the window. If it's busy like on that night, expect to share the table with other patrons. It's a nice concept but not so if you're looking for something more private and romantic.Fun cocktail menu. I chose the cocktail of the day which was a sangria. Smokey and tasty! It was good! The only bugger was that we wanted Modelo beer but they ran out so they suggested us the Corona. Here's the little problem. They're the same price (7$). Usually the Modelo is pricier.We ordered something small to snack before our JFL show. We got the large (7$) guacamole and the small (3,50$) frijoles. They both came with house baked tortillas. They came in the same sized bowl though. Hmmm. One of our tortilla bowl was bit and pieces like if they were scrapped from the bottom of the container. Then we got the mahi-mahi taco (15$) and the "ribaye" taco (13$). Everything was delicious! Fresh. Tangy. Great balance of flavours. Well prepared and cooked. The tortillas were moist and had a bite to them. They also put a red salsa and green salsa, both homemade, on the table. I want to buy some of the salsas. That's how good they were!The service was ok. Not bad nor good. We felt rushed and it kinda bothered me a bit. I mean i had just finished my last bite and they came right away to take it from us and half a minute later they asked if we wanted one or two bills. So, so guac and frijoles. Very good tacos. Will i come back? Maybe after i try ALL the other Mexican-tacos restaurants this great city of ours has to offer! ;)

The best tacos al pastor in Montreal!! If you are reading this review, you have to trust me . I'm Mexican and I LOVE TACOS!!!! I've been out of my country for 8 years and today finally eat a good taco. Thank you Capital Tacos for the amazing meal that I have today!!

I really liked this place. It has vegan options which I really appreciate. We got guacamole and chips, vegan tinga tacos and coconut yogurt with cinnamon - all delicious! Will come here again next time I come to Montreal. It does get busy so you might have to wait.

I've been here several times and a great stop for a bite during the just for laughs festival. Random place for a Mexican restaurant right in heart of China town l, seems like there are others opening up as well.  I'm always impressed the the freshness of the meat and quality of the tacos. The hot sauce (green) is amazing. It did take a while to get the food out but seeing that they are cooking on a grill and fresh I'll wait a bit. The tortillas are super soft and  loved the beaf rib eye. Home made salsa has a kick and packed with flavor. I like that it's not over dressed with sauces.. I can appreciate the the flavor of the meat. I also recommend the fish tacos.. They also have vegetarian option.. when I first went they didn't have a liquor license. Now that they do the selection is quite good. Yes they do have corona with a slice of lime! As for the decor .. if u ever been to Mexico it's not meant to be over the top .. I can't say it's eye catching at all but it's doesn't have to be. I like the common seating it brings that friendly social environment. If ur not very social that look at ur plate and partner. If you are well make new friends! I find it nice that the summer the front is completely open with sliding doors. So yes we don't live alone on this earth there will be spiders and bugs! A spider can build a complete  web in 30min...expect to see them around. I don't expect the staff to start swatting flys and bugs all night long. I personally haven't been attacked by them lol .. if you leave u windows open all day you will have uninvited guests. Montreal's summer days are numbered I'm glad we can enjoy the open air at a restaurant .. If you happen to go when there are festivals expect a line.. and it could take a while.

Small place so there may be line but the steak tacos were so good I'd stand in line over and over again. The portions were much larger than I thought they would be - you get 3 tortillas with each but there's about 4 servings of beef. The service was super quick despite how packed it was.

Absolutely some of the friendliest staff, after overhearing me say how good these tacos were, they told me I would have to come back to have all the others besides their El Pastor taco (pork).Their spicy sauce was perfectly balanced, as all things should be. The pork in the tacos was a beuatiful texture, and the tscos had the right amount of crunch,even though they were soft.Definitely coming back.
This place opens late and gets busier by the hour.Ordered the beef and beer battered shrimp - both were solid, especially the beef. Nice overall restaurant but I wouldn't call it memorable.
Great tacos. Very flavorful though sparse on topping ootions. Quite simple but Pricey however for street tacos.

Whattttttt!This taco spot is Bomb Dot Com!Super chill and hip spot, very comfortable & low key.During lunch when my wife and I stopped by on Friday afternoon it wasn't too busy but had a good amount of people indoors.We ordered Guacamole, 2 Margaritas on the rocks, carnitas tacos, steak tacos & fried bananas for desert.We also got free refried beans!To make this quick I'll give each thing a rating 1-5, 5 being, GET THAT DISH!Refried Beans - 5.5Guacamole - 3.5Margaritas - 4.5Carnitas - 5.5Steak - 6!!! (Sooo tender and grilled to perfection)Friend Bananas - 5Everything here was sooooo ******ing good!I would definitely make it a point to come back every time we are in town.

Where do you find some of the best tacos you'll have in your entire life? Oddly enough, in French-Canada...and in Chinatown! La Capital Tacos is an absolute gem, with delicious appetizers, drinks and some of the best carnitas I've ever tasted. We started with guacamole and the frijoles negros, both of which were absolutely delicious. Wife and I split the shrimp tacos and the carnitas tacos and they were top notch. The spicy sauce is quite spicy, so be warned. The jalapeno sauce was more my speed. The service was friendly and prompt, especially given how busy they were. Definitely a great spot for a fun dinner when visiting Montreal.

Stopped in during the Jazz Festival and was not disappointed. The guacamole and queso were great. We ordered five different types of tacos and the were all very good. The service was friendly and accommodating. Highly recommend this place as one on the best tacos in the city.

These tacos are delicious! I wasn't even hungry when my group of five arrived. We ordered guacamole, Pastor, Cochinita Pibil, and a Quesadilla. My friends enjoyed their Tam Tam beer. If you want a nice affordable and tasty bite to eat, stop in!

I always wondered why there's a random taco restaurant in chinatown, but I decided to try it out. Actually quite delicious! And the service was friendly. I ordered the sauté mushrooms tacos. I'm actually quite pleased that a vegetarian dish can be so flavorful! Not many restaurants can achieve this. The only downfall was that it was 11$ taxes excluded for 3 tiny tacos. If only there were more for the price! We sat near the brick wall side of the restaurant and can't help notice that there are cobwebs and dust hanging off the walls. Hopefully they'll clean that soon. Would hate to have that fall onto a customer.

If you are an arachnophobia person, don't ever get close to this place!!!Worse place ever!!! Unless you are not afraid of spiders, that you will not be disgusted by their bathroom neither by the slow and bad service...They have plenty (spiders)....The waitress tell us that: "oh it's ok they won't bite you as I fed them this morning"; The manager pulled a let saying, when I asked to move table as 2 of the big spiders (besides of plenty of others...) kept fighting and coming down, "ohhh no worries I will take them down, I won't move you other seats" what he never did (remove the spiders) ...So, 15 minutes after that we got our food, what was basically 45-60 minutes after we got there plus 20-30 minutes outside waiting), he came to us and said:"ohhh I'm sorry but it would make too much noise at the restaurant to take them out... )Food was ok, service super slow. They share tables between people what me and my friends had no problem at all with, but we had with the fact that they got their drinks and food much before us, and we got our seats and order much before they got their seats!!!)They never excused themselves for the slow service, neither for the spiders circumstances and not even offer a drink or a rebate...Opposite, I got an extra drink in our bill but I paid without saying a word to not need to stay longer!!!Take a look in their dust of the fixtures, the spiders moving around in their ceilings, and also the black spots at their sign outside (if you zoom it, you will see the spiders!!!)Worst experience ever!!!I don't recommend this place to anyone, if I could put ZERO starts... I would, but the minimum is 1, so 1 it is...
Got take out here while we were on vacation. The tacos and guacamole were fantastic. If we didn't live 3000 miles away I'd totally make this my go to taco joint.

Very few seats. Very busy. No theme. Service gets food on your plate and drinks in your hands quick - under 20 minutes. Oh, if you don't like spiders don't come. They have a one spider per light policy.The tacos are great. The appetizers need work. The potatoes rock and so do the beets. Avoid the veggie that you don't recognize.The after food contact is minimal.

Very very good tacos. I particularly like the carnitas. My vegetarian partner had several good options on the menu. The location was also perfect on our last visit - right by where we needed to change buses coming from the airport. They even accomodated our luggage:)

You gotta get Mexican food in Chinatown in Montreal, duh. This little hot spot made me soooo happy on our Canadian excursion. After many days I was really craving tacos, which we eat all the time at home. Distance makes the heart grow fonder, and I was thrilled to see La Capital pop up on Yelp when I searched for nearby lunch finds. You wouldn't expect this restaurant to be nestled amongst the many pho and ramen places or Asian food markets, but it's there and it's wonderful.It's ultra casual inside and pretty crowded at lunch time. Concrete floors, big heavy tables, and a tiny bar space (although they don't serve any alcohol as of now). They're got fresh squeezed juice on the menu, and then their speciality - authentic tacos. Chicken, fish, carnitas, steak, al pastor... the classics. We started with the chips and guacamole, which were wonderful. The chips are pretty dark and initially looked like they might be over-fried, but they tasted great. The guacamole was delicious as well, and super fresh. There are 3 different types of salsa in little plastic squeezy bottles... I believe my favorite was the green/verde, which was super-fresh, cool, and cilantro-y.We also ordered a side of refried beans which I LOVED. Amazing authentic flavor with just the right amount of cheese on top. We decided on the 3 plate al pastor tacos for our entree. Our waitress actually forgot to put in our order, and we waited for quite awhile before we realized and asked her to double check. She was super apologetic and even brought us one extra taco free of charge. I was happy because the tacos were delicious. The meat was incredibly tender and the fresh pineapple is always a beautiful accompaniment. Plus, the corn tortillas appeared to be homemade - wonderful texture and just the right thickness.Be prepared to wait for a seat right at lunchtime. Chinatown is already super busy with tourists, and this restaurant is one-of-a-kind in the neighborhood! I think it'd be worth the wait, however. One of my favorite places during our trip.

Cute atmosphere. Servers are nice but it was a little hard to get their attention. Drinks are delicious. We had the jaime del grande..the pastor and ribeye tacos are delicious as well. Realistically would rate a 3.5-3.8.

I am not a Taco person but these honestly were the best Tacos I've had and it was funny that it was in Canada and in the middle of Chinatown.Ever since coming here my boyfriend and I could not stop raving and talking about these tacos! I've told all my friends that if they ever come to Montreal this place was not to be missed.On a Sunday the group I was with wanted to go to another location but it was closed. There were so many places closed so they asked me to search on Yelp to see where we could go. I stumbled upon this place and it was open so I told them to let's take a chance and come here.I'm so glad that we did because everything was on point. The menu was limited they just have tacos and apps and drinks but everything was amazing that you won't care that they don't have anything else.I've had cochinita pibil in Mexico and loved it so anytime I see it on a menu I have to order it. I got the cochinita pibil tacos which came with three tacos and my boyfriend ordered the same. It was so amazing and flavorful so much so that even though we were both full we decided to make another order to share.It must have been really popular because the waiter told us they only had enough cochinita pibil to make two tacos so he suggested we do two cochinita pibils and one carnitas taco. We didn't care so we said sure.Turns out there had been a mixup and another table was accidentally given our second order or tacos with cochinita pibil and we got three carnitas tacos. We weren't upset and said we would still take them but the waiter must have felt bad because he gave us all shots on the house!Come here and you will not be disappointed!
Staff isn't able to speak french... "deer in then headlights" style if they hear an utterance of french. Too bad, tacos were nice.

Super cute taco place in Chinatown! Who would've thought? I really liked their quesadillas which came in individual portions but that just means you get to sample multiple flavours! They had a great selection of tacos and other snack foods. I would skip the appetizers, they're on the small end and just get more variety of mains. I would also get a freshly squeezed coconut water if they're offering that! What a great dining experience! The only downside is that because they are located quite close to several office buildings there is a huge lunch rush between 12 - 1 and so you might be uncomfortably squeezed next to two strangers. This could be avoided with more individual tables but otherwise amazing dining experience!

Amazinggggg tacos! Ordered the al pastor tacos and it got me craving for more! The al pastor was so well flavored. The avocado sauce on the side was creamy and delicious! People it is worth the wait !!!
Very dry and tasteless. Won't come again. Although, the restaurant is not busy, the service is very slow.

Some of the best Tacos in town ! The concept of a Mexican restaurant in Chinatown sounds odd but the blend of the two cultures coexist perfectly ! The restaurant A couple of great vegetarian options are available even with a limited menu. The potatoes and the two sauces are amazing as-well.Sometimes the wait times are hard for the eyes but the food is more then worth the wait ! Definitely give this place a try.

It did not take us long to be regulars here, the tacos are the real deal! The Rib Tacos were our favourite, but you can't go wrong with any of them! It's a great casual eatery that has that young, hip and stylish vibe. PS- I think the other reviewers were a bit harsh with their comments in regards to the resident 'spiders'. I reaaaaallly looked and didn't notice a problem..

We was in MONTREAL for few days with my family and my wife found this place.First this place is in CHINATOWN, Montreal center,The MEXICAN FOOD  is the Best I live in MIAMI  and we have good Mexican food here but THE CAPITAL TACOS mis respetos,Super recomendados.Amazing Si vas a MONTREAL, QUEBEC y quieres comer rico ve a este restaurante.Las chicas muy atentas
The food is fresh, inexpensive and the customer service is excellent, the ambiance is relaxed. I had the carnitas tacos, with re-fried beans and guacamole with tortilla chips and it was delicious

Simple menu with about 6 types of tacos, 4 quesadillas and a few entrees.  We tried 3 tacos & 2 quesadillas. Every single one was fresh and delicious. The tortillas are even toasted to be a little golden.  Nothing was spicy, but they do put hot sauce on table which is a necessary addition for me. What's Mexican food without a little spice right?  The mojito was good, and the margarita I found strong.  Prices are fair and the service is great. I'll definitely be coming back.
Excellent service and great food. Will come again! Recently moved to the area and so hard to find Mexican food.

So we ordered take out, not only did they feel like they had to add their own service charge for just handing us a bag with our food, but also on top of that we have to pay extra for takeout?!!! Totally unacceptable...

Without a doubt the worst service I have ever received. It was very packed on a Monday night and took about an hour for our food to come out. After our food finally arrived, our order was wrong, meaning it would be another 15-20 for our food to come out! At this point we cancelled our order and just wanted to pay for the one dish they got right. To top it all off they charged us for the food we didn't get and refused to give us a refund. No food is worth horrible service. They need to hire more waiters and be courteous for having folks wait an hour + for food. Everyone in the restaurant was clearly frustrated with the lack of attention. I'd give this place 0 stars if I could.
The tacos and quesadilla were delicious. It was a neat atmosphere. I would be delighted to go back there again!

Interesting experience. Simple menu, which is nice. The food has great combinations but the flavor is not there. Probably shouldn't have ordered Mexican in the middle of China Town Montréal anyway. Rookie mistake. Ordered- guacamole, blacks beans (texture of peanut butter), pastor tacos, potatoes and pirata quesadilla. 6/10 experience.

While the servers there were very attentive and nice, I found the food very underwhelming and even disappointing. We had eaten at many different spots in Montreal which were beyond delicious and so we had our hopes up for this spot since the reviews were so great. Unfortunately, it was nothing special with small portions and slightly overpriced food. We left hungry and disappointed. The  margaritas were however delicious so that was a plus. Overall, not the worst but definitely not the best spot for food.  I would highly recommend the drinks, but not the food.

I've been to this place for lunch and supper a couple of times. Really love the shrimp tacos and the grilled beef tacos! Also a fan of their guacamole, although the portion is quite small for the price. If you are ordering the tacos, you get 3 per plate and depending on what you order range from $10-$14 a plate. They also have some selection of beer and cocktails if you go there at night. And surprisingly enough they have mexican coca cola! Overall giving this place 4 stars because of the price in terms of portion size.

Worst service ever. Go here if you want annoying college kids screaming and talking obnoxiously loud as if the whole restaurant needs to listen to their conversation. Also to receive service too casual (forgets about you/let's other people who came in after you to sit first).We asked for the check, the girl said sure but then forgot about us to go outside for a smoke break as we're sitting there for 10 minutes before we could grab a different girls attention. (not attentive enough)Tacos were bland, it's just deep fried batter and sauce you literally tasting.Only place on the block that has these nasty flying bugs that hangs out in the front of their restaurant and a few does fly in and it's really gross and disturbing while you are trying to eat.

I had the guacamole and shrimp tacos with water. The chips looked homemade and we're extra crispy. Guacamole was nothing special but none the less excellent. You got three tacos with two types of sauce. Hint: the red sauce is the hot sauce. The bill was for over $18. So definitely not one dollar sign. Maybe not even two dollar signs $18 for two tacos in a little cup of guacamole. I'm going to put $3 signs. But excellent all around 5 stars.

We walked in to a small restaurant. Nothing fancy. We got seated right away. The menu is limited. The menu has appetizers, tacos, and quesadillas. The prices are reasonable!  They serve alcohol (esp. margaritas, cervezas, and tequila) and soft drinks too (water of course!) we ordered an appetizer and two taco dishes. The appetizer which was a small order of guacamole came with taco dishes. I would have preferred it to come 1st while we wait for our main dishes. (That is why I am giving 4 not 5 stars) The staff are very friendly too!

Really good food and drinks. Place is small so make sure you give yourself time to be seated during the late afternoon. The tacos are really good in flavors and love the quality of the food. At first the tacos might look small but in the order you get 3 tacos and trust me, for a quick bite you can get fill with them. This place is a must visit. The place is a little loud but is cool.
Best tacos in Montreal hands down. Yeah, they are located in China town but they definitely know how to make tacos and some good adult beverages.

I went there with 4 other coworkers on a friday for lunch. We got there around noon and the place was almost full. We managed to get a table near the cashier in the back.The menu looked quite simple as there were not many choices. I've heard good comments about the tacos, but I chose to order 2 quesadillas (i'm a cheese lover): gringa & pirata.It took more than 30 minutes to get all our orders. For that kind of wait, I had high expectations for our tacos and quesadillas. You know, if it take that long to make such simple dishes, it must be something fancy or at least a big plate. But what we got blew my mind away. It was ... plain and simple...and i had something that looked like a small tortilla folded on pulled beef with nothing else... i could barely see any cheese coming out of it...The taste was good but not worth all the wait. Besides, the place is really noisy and the ventation was bad; you could see the smoke around the table and the smell sticks to your clothes. Beware if you are seated near the entrance, you better keep your coat on! I was sitting on the nack and could feel a chilly breeze.Overall, the taste of the tacos/quesadillas is good, but I will never go there again for lunch time. The service was very average. While the waiter was cleaning our table, he dropped some sauce on my coworker and seemed very lunatic. Not worth the trip.
Ordered steak tacos Meat was good Tortilla was yummy But there was nothing else on the tacos Disappointing when it was $4.50 eachAnd they charged a fee for splitting the plate
Can't go wrong with the battered shrimp tacos at La Capital Tacos! Make sure to get there early for dinner cause it gets busy quick!

I would say authentic Mexican taco. The environment was nice and beer are fairly cheap. Service can be slow if the place gets busy, especially if the waiters forgot about you sitting at the corner. Waited 20 minuets without water and still got the wrong tacos. The weirdest part was after we got a waitress's attention, she looked at us  like we just stole her money. Totally bizarre experience.Good food, bad service.

AWESOME FOOD!!! What was amazing is that you can share the tacos so you can try different ones and they're very filling! I'm definitely coming back!!!Better than Satay Brothers, not as much on the menu as Satay Brothers, but laid back vibe and great service. Quality of the food is excellent!

Mexican-restaurant-on-the-edge-of-Chinatown is this place's theme, if it had a theme. Tacos served on Chinese-inspired plateware.The tacos are really good (including vegan options!), although the service can be a bit bogged down with over-crowdedness. If there's a wait to get in, it will move quickly. Definitely worth the wait and the mild inconvenience of slow service.

Last spring, I went to visit Montréal for a short getaway trip from the states. This was the first restaurant we went to and wow did we find a jackpot. The servers were extremely nice and helpful and the food was amazing. I still think about the  quesadillas we had from this place (and this was months ago!). The drinks were also very good. Highly recommend

Good value for money...we were here at 730 on a Saturday night and there was a line. We got in after 15 minutes. Their tacos al pastor was delish and a great value for only $10 with 3 tacos on the plate. The meat was seasoned well, cooked well with some toasty bits! The drinks were all above $10, reasonable except that they were a bit watered down. Expect to share a table with others as the place is small. I will go back when i find myself in Old Montreal again.

They have quick good food. My family and I came here on  a Friday around 5 and we all enjoyed the food. The guacamole with chips were a nice starter. We had the ribeye tacos, cochinita taco and a quesadillas. It was all very tasty. The salsa aren't really spicy but gives your food a little kick. They have good customer service which is part of the experience.

Came across this little spot as we were walking around (it was near our hotel), and being that I'm from NY I can say I've had some pretty darn good food. To start, the wait was long (we were a party of 6), but the host was very attentive to us as we waited outside, and apologized several times for the wait. Eventually we sat down and I ordered the frijoles with chips and it was divine! I could literally lick the bowl!!! Then we all ordered different tacos so that we could swap/share. PastorRosarito Rib eye All amazing! The guacamole was okay, but definitely order it because what's Mexican food without guac?! The service was also mediocre, but I've had worse. I'm from NY so I'm used to mediocre everything lol. Anyways, try this place!

Tacos down at Chinatown; La Capital Tacos had the cozy Chinatown vibe to it. If you're around Town and looking for some tacos, check the spot out then go for some dragon beard candy and bubble tea afterwards!On to the food: I ordered some of their Carnitas tacos while starting off with some grilled beets, along with some chips & guacamole. I liked it, I should've asked for some more of that sauce though... #keveatsregrets

We came here based on yelp recommendations and we were not disappointed! This is the definition of five stars, we are visiting from the states and usually the language barrier creates a problem but not here. We actually killed two birds in one stone, tacos and were able to see China town.We were seated and attended quickly, food was taken and arrived quickly as well. The carnita tacos were scrumptious with the sauces and the frijoles were too, everything had flavor and was fresh. The flan chocolate cake was amazing as well!
Amazing tacos & drinks!One of the best mexican restaurants in Montreal.The location is perfect, not too big t'not too small, food is perfect quantities & portions, excellent quality.

Solid little taco place, tasty, however, I found the presentation lacking and the prices a little expensive for what you get.  I also thought the staff friendly, but a tad unprofessional in some of their interactions... especially with each other. The atmosphere is a bit tatty, as well.

My girlfriend and I came to Montreal, Quebec for the first time and we had a craving for some Mexican. After stumbling upon "la capital tacos" by accident on Yelp we decided to go. It's in china town which seemed a little odd but the place is small and intimate with a very authentic feel. We ordered the "chicharron de queso" which is a cone of fried cheese. The beer battered shrimp tacos and the chips and quac. OMG!!!!! This place is phenomenal!!! The price is sooooo fair for what you get and the food is sooo authentic. Everything was so tasty this place is so amazing that I'll def miss it when I go back to Toronto and will definitely want to have it again before we leave!! Can't rave enough about this place! So good!!

What an excellent find in the middle of china town. Just the fact that they used corn tortillias made the 5 stars. But it was not only that it was the meat the spice pretty much everything. Just great. I cant wait to bring more customers there.

Mexican food in china town! Was a little skeptical but glad I tried it! Cool ambiance, good music. Service was good and friendly. Food was delicious and authentic. Ordered the guacamole with chips (fresh and tasty) and the cochinitas pibil tacos (3 tacos each order)-super yummy!

Beautiful decor and lively ambiance. I ordered the beer battered shrimp tacos and shared a side order of frijoles and guacamole with friends. The tacos were super yummy and filling, the sides were all delicious and the staff gives free chip refills. The cocktails are also great. The place is worth the price although it is a little bit of a splurge. Would recommend if you are going out with friends/want to treat yourself.

Love, love, love the flavors of this place. The right amount of spice and flavors. I hade the pastor tacos and I ( nor anyone) could find anything negative. Full tacos the way they're supposed to be. I also had the beer batter shrimp tacos and I found just a touch too much batter but if they change that I have to give this place a 5 star.
Best tacos I have tried in Canada and I'm from Mexico. Nice vibes all over, definitely would come back!

Honestly soooo overrated, I get that Montréal doesn't have many authentic taco places, but please don't think that this is the best you can do.Frijoles have an intense smokey flavour that just doesn't belong.Guac is alright, no more no less.I had the carnitas and the pork was very dry. My friend had the shrimp one and was underwhelmed; the option to grill the shrimp rather than deep fry them should be offered. Apparently the tempeh al pastor was alright, but lacked a punch of some sort.If you come at peak dinner time, be prepared to wait outside for a while and expect slow service (although the employees are all very sweet)So yeah, not a must-try.

Found this place walking by late on a Sunday night craving some taco goodness. Was open and people were seated at the counter, good hip hop blasting, welcoming smile from the service team and I grabbed a seat. Looked at Yelp for intel and went with the server recommendations  which did not disappoint. Great tacos, came out pretty quick kitchen seems on point, the peanut hot sauce was awesome and a true creeper, great flavor best of the bunch. Nacho chips were good too. Tacos in Chinatown, only in MTL. Great spot would come back if in the area.

I've tried tacos all over the United States, including Colorado, Texas, and California. The tacos here give them a run for the money. I expected to be underwhelmed and I was absolutely wrong. The pastor was perfectly tender and had just enough spice. The fried shrimp had a good crunch outside and were soft - not chewy - on the inside. If you're in Montréal and craving some Mexican tacos, this is where you want to be
The vegan tacos have no right to be this delicious, and the refried beans have a lot of depth of flavour.  The service was fast, too. Really couldn't ask for anything more.

Great taco place! Four of us shared some guacamole, beans and grilled green onions as appetizers! We ordered the rib eye taco, carnita and the special of the day ( fried shrimp in coconut batter). The rib eye was ok, the carnita and shrimp were the stars! Awesome and original drinks and great service!

I don't know what the hype is about and why is it at 4 stars but nope. Never going back ever again.First of all, I think that the prices are a little too high.I can't even remember what we ordered but they were all not worth it. I remember each bite wasn't pleasant. I felt forced to finish everything because it would be a waste of money and didn't want to be rude. All to say, a lot of hipsters go there and I think it's more about the ''decor'' than the food itself. If I could I would give this place 0 stars. The waiter was nice but the rest of the staff just looked miserable. I got there and regretted stepping in. I've had better Mexican food and this place is not even close to good. As in, I would much rather go to 3 amigos! Do you know how bad that sounds?!

This place was amazing when I visited MTL recently. As a native of Southern California, I *know* and *love* my tacos, and I *LOVE* La Capital! During a 7 day stay in MTL I ate at La Capital 4 times.
